CatDescriptText: Joseph Gustave, janitor, 48 Reed Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you favor an increase in state sales tax or a graduated income tax as a means of raising revenue for a commonwealth of Pennsylvania?" answer reads: "I think that the graduated income tax will be the better because I think that I can pay it better than the other. There are steady deductions and you know that the income tax is due on a certain time on a certain date of a certain month."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joseph Gustave wearing worn leather jacket, dark hat, and cardigan sweater with two square pockets, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
